articles.author: Devdiscourse
articles.title: US Domestic News Briefs: Hunter Biden Case, Juneteenth Celebration
articles.description: This set of US domestic news briefs covers key events including the start of juror deliberations in Hunter Biden’s criminal gun case, a Juneteenth celebration at the White House, a Massachusetts court ruling on a student’s speech rights, and updates on Donald Trump’s legal issues and campaign activities.
articles.content:
Following is a summary of current US domestic news briefs.
Jurors begin deliberations in Hunter Biden's criminal gun case
The jury began deliberations on Monday in the case of Hunter Biden, the U.S. president's son accused of lying about his use of i... [5792 chars]

articles.description: New Jersey attorney general looks into whether Trump is ineligible to hold licenses at three of his golf courses in state
articles.content:

articles.author: Devdiscourse
articles.title: Donald Trump's Pre-Sentencing Interview Raises Questions of Special Treatment
articles.description: Former President Donald Trump's mandatory pre-sentencing interview was brief and uneventful, concluding in under half an hour. The interview, conducted via video conference, has sparked criticism for special treatment, highlighting disparities in the justice system. Trump's sentencing for falsifying business records is scheduled for July 11.
articles.content: Donald Trump's mandatory pre-sentencing interview concluded in less than 30 minutes, raising questions about preferential treatment. A New York City probation officer conducted the interview, which will inform Judge Juan M. Merchan's sentencing decis... [679 chars]
